description.narrative: The development impact of the Project is expected to be high. The Bank already has a locally recognised franchise and a loyal customer base in servicing micro- and small businesses, including those in the remote regions, small towns and rural areas. This segment is underserved and especially lacks access to quality financial services, on both lending and savings sides.

The proposed project is to provide a US$5 million straight senior loan to Forus Bank (Forus or Bank). The loan is intended to support the Banks micro-lending operations in the European part of Russia. Forus Bank is a unique specialized microfinance institution, located in Nizhny Novgorod. The Bank was formed by FORA Fund, a non-banking microfinance organization in Russia, part of Opportunity International Microfinance Network. Since then Forus has gone through a transformation into a commercial bank and managed to build a sustainable business model and a recognized brand. IFC has been engaged with the Bank since 2006. At the moment Forus is the only commercial bank in Russia specialized on lending to micro enterprises. The Bank operates through 6 regional branches and 34 satellite offices located in 26 regions of Russia, which translates into the market share of about 2.5% of the total microfinance market in Russia.
